newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's Sverdlovsk region plans Eurobond issue.
newsitem.headline: Russia's Sverdlovsk region plans Eurobond issue.

text.p: Russia's Sverdlovsk region, based around the Urals city of Yekaterinburg, plans to issue Eurobonds soon, a local government official said on Friday.
"We have discussed the issue at a meeting of the administration and decided to work out an issue programme," Nikolai Bespamyatnykh, deputy head of the economy committee, told Reuters.
He said the programme would be ready in up to two months.
Inkombank will organise the programme and act as its agent.

Inkombank vice-president Rafael Nagapetyants told the administration meeting that the first stage of the programme provided for a $20 million European commercial paper issue with a tenor of between three to five months.
In a second stage Svedlovsk would issue medium-term Euronotes and Eurobonds with a tenor of five years, Nagapetyants said. But Bespamyatnykh said the government had not approved any of the terms.
Russia is now preparing a debut Eurobond issue for later this year, and the city of Moscow has also announced plans to issue Eurobonds.
